Stochastic state-space Inference and Prediction

Parameter¶

class pysip.core.Parameter(name, value=None, loc=0.0, scale=1.0, transform=None, bounds=(None, None), prior=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A Parameter has a value in the constrained space \(\theta\) and in the unconstrained space \(\eta\). These two values are linked by the relation

\begin{equation*} \theta = loc + f(\eta) \times scale \end{equation*}

where \(\theta_{sd} = f(\eta)\) is one of the following transform

  • none: \(\theta_{sd} = \eta \qquad \theta_{sd} \in ]-\infty, \infty[\)

  • log: \(\theta_{sd} = \exp(\eta) \qquad \theta_{sd} \in [0, \infty[\)

  • lower: \(\theta_{sd} = \exp(\eta) + a \qquad \theta_{sd} \in [a, \infty[\)

  • upper: \(\theta_{sd} = b - \exp(\eta) \qquad \theta_{sd} \in ]-\infty, b]\)

  • logit: \(\theta_{sd} = a+\frac{(b-a)}{1+\exp(-\eta)}\qquad\theta_{sd}\in [a, b]\)

where \(a\) and \(b\) are the lower and upper bounds given as a tuple, such that, bounds = \((a, b)\). If transform = ‘fixed’ the parameter is not considered as a random variable.

The prior distribution is on the standardized constrained parameter value \(\theta_{sd}\). In order to put the prior on the constrained parameter value \(\theta\), use the default configuration, loc = 0 and scale = 1.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Parameter name

  • value (Optional[Real]) – Parameter value

  • loc (Real) – Location value

  • scale (Real) – Scaling value

  • transform (Optional[str]) – Bijections

  • bounds (Tuple[Real]) – Parameters bounds

  • prior (Optional[Prior]) – Prior distribution

_d_penalty()[source]¶

Derivative of the penalty function

Return type

float

_inv_transform()[source]¶

Do inverse transformation \(\theta_{sd} = f^{-1}(\eta)\)

_inv_transform_dlog_jacobian()[source]¶

Get the jacobian of the logarithm of the inverse transform

\(\frac{\partial \ln(\theta_{sd})}{\partial \eta}\)

Return type

float

_inv_transform_jacobian()[source]¶

Get the jacobian of \(\theta_{sd} = f^{-1}(\eta)\)

Return type

float

Penalty function

Return type

float

_transform()[source]¶

Do transformation \(\eta = f(\theta_{sd})\)

Get the jacobian of \(\eta = f(\theta_{sd})\)

Returns unconstrained parameter value \(\eta\)

Return type

float

property free¶

Returns True if the parameter is not fixed

Return type

Return type
